page.title: 14RISELEY FEAST
page.content: Special services,games in the vicarage garden,tea and cakes for the Sunday school children,cricket matches,the village full of visitors with swinging boats and amusements for their pleasure - these were the activites that characterised Riseley's feast a hundred years ago,a time of merry making,thanksgiving and re-dedication held on the weekend following St. Mary Magdalen's Day (July 22). In the recent years,the feast has largely ignored,but there is a move now to restore this old tradition. Last year a succesful picnic was held for the Sunday school children. This year a special service is planned in All Saints Church, including the traditional prize-giving to Sunday school children,followed by a family lunch and games in the new vicarage garden.
